title: 8%+ Dividend Yields Are Back: Top 10 Stocks for 2025 Passive Income
shortdescription: Energy, REITs, and telecoms offer highest sustainable yields since 2009.
author: Mark Blaze

content.content: After years of near-zero interest rates crushed dividend investors, 8%+ yields have returned with a vengeance in 2025. The combination of falling bond yields and undervalued sectors has created the best income opportunities since the 2009 financial crisis. Energy infrastructure, telecom giants, and select REITs now offer sustainable 7–9% yields with payout ratios under 60% — levels not seen in over a decade.

AT&T and Verizon lead the pack at 7.8% and 7.2% respectively, both trading at 8-year lows despite stable cash flows. Energy Transfer offers 8.9% with growing volumes from Permian Basin production, while Realty Income — the 'monthly dividend company' — yields 7.5% with 30 years of consecutive increases. These aren't distressed companies; they're mature businesses trading at depressed valuations due to sector rotation away from income stocks during the low-rate era.

With the Federal Reserve signaling rate cuts, these high-yield stocks become even more attractive. A 1% drop in interest rates typically boosts dividend stock valuations by 10–15%. The current environment combines high starting yields with improving growth prospects. For retirees and income-focused investors, this represents a rare opportunity to lock in 8%+ yields on blue-chip names with strong balance sheets and growing distributions.
